resources.string:
This app was created to help people explore subjects in STEM.

 It was developed by a team of RVT students during a Hackathon event.

 The main focus of the app is to assist individuals in learning programming in Python, providing them with a solid understanding of its fundamental concepts.

Leaderboard:
Es #1
Es un tikai es.
Tu arī nē…
Hello, I am a chatbot. I will help you learn programming.
The first thing any programmer should do is type Hello World!
To print something on screen use function \"print()\"
In a more common scenario, you\'d want to communicate some message to the end user.
First, you may pass a text directly to \"print()\"\n\nprint(\'Message Text\')
In this example message \'Message Text\' is string.
A string is a sequence of characters. Strings are used to store text data.
Strings are created by enclosing characters in single or double quotes.
Let\'s try write program that outputs \"Hello World!\"

The first thing any programmer
should create program that outputs "Hello World!"

Try to make this program.
Good job! You have completed your first program.
Now let\'s try something more complicated.
You could extract that message into its own variable with a meaningful name to enhance readability and promote code reuse
A variable is a container for a value, which can be of various types. You can think of variables as a way to store information in your program.
To create a variable, you just assign it a value and then start using it. Assignment is done with a single equals sign (=)
Now you can use the variable message anywhere in the program, and its value will be equal to the string "Hello my Friends!"
You can also change the value of a variable later on:\nprint(message)

Now let's try something more complicated.

Try to make program, which assigns the value 
('Hello World!') to the variable 
(result).
Good job! You have completed your second program.
Now let\'s try something more complicated.\n\nTry to make this program.
If statements are control flow statements which helps us to run a particular code only when a certain condition is satisfied.
The if statement alone tells us that if a condition is true it will execute a block of statements and if the condition is false it won\'t.
